ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.2_0: On one occasion a monk was walking for almsfood along a street in Sāvatthī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.2_1: a certain nun walked for almsfood along a street.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.3_0: And that monk said to that nun, “Go to such-and-such a place, Sister, and you’ll get alms,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.4_0: and she said the same to him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.5_0: And because they met frequently, they became friends.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.6_0: Just then robe-cloth belonging to the Sangha was being distributed.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.7_0: Then, after going to the instruction, she approached that monk,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.7_1: and after approaching and worshipping that monk, he stood on one side.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.8_0: He then said to her, “Sister, this is my share of the robe-cloth.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.11_0: As a consequence his robes, too, became worn.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.12_0: Other monks said to him, “Why don’t you make a robe for yourself?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.14_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.15_0: “How can a monk give robe-cloth to a nun?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.16_0: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.20_0: “Foolish man, a man and a woman who are unrelated don’t know what’s appropriate and what’s inappropriate in dealing with each other, what’s right and what’s wrong.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.21_0: And still you gave robe-cloth to an unrelated nun.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.22_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.23_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.24.1_0: ‘If a monk gives robe-cloth to an unrelated nun, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.25_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.1_0: Once this had happened, monks did not even give robe-cloth to nuns in exchange, being afraid of wrongdoing.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.2_0: The nuns complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.3_0: “How can they not give us robe-cloth in exchange?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.4_0: The monks heard the complaints of those nuns
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.6_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.7_0: “Monks, if it is part of an exchange, I allow you to give things to five kinds of people:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.8_0: monks, nuns, trainee nuns, novice monks, and novice nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.9_0: “Monks, if it is part of an exchange, I allow you to give things to five kinds of people:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.10_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.11.1_0: ‘If a monk gives robe-cloth to an unrelated nun, except if it is an exchange, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.1.6_0: anyone who is not a descendant of one’s male ancestors going back seven generations, either on the mother’s side or on the father’s side.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.1.8_0: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.1.10_0: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be transferred to another.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.1.11_0: Except if it is an exchange:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.1_0: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he gives her robe-cloth, except if it is an exchange, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.2_0: If she is unrelated, but he is unsure of it, and he gives her robe-cloth, except if it is an exchange, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.3_0: If she is unrelated, but he perceives her as related, and he gives her robe-cloth, except if it is an exchange, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.4_0: If he gives robe-cloth to a nun who is fully ordained only on one side, except if it is an exchange, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.5_0: If she is related, but he perceives her as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.6_0: If she is related, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.7_0: If she is related, and he perceives her as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.3_0: if much is exchanged with little or little is exchanged with much;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.4_0: if the nun takes it on trust;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.5_0: if she grabs it for the post;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.6_0: if he gives any requisite apart from robe-cloth;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.7_0: if it is a trainee nun;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.8_0: if it is to a novice nun;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.10_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.11_0: The fifth rule, the training rule on giving robe-cloth, is finished.
